compliance_reasoning: The regulation applies to this document as it is a financial product document from AIB Life, which would be a regulated entity under the Central Bank of Ireland. The document contains pension scheme rules that consumers need to understand to make informed decisions. While parts of the document are clear with defined terms and structured sections, there are areas where the language and presentation could be improved to ensure an average consumer can reasonably understand the content. The document includes a definitions section which helps clarify technical terms, but some complex concepts and legal language may still be difficult for an average consumer to fully comprehend.

gap_description: The document contains technical pension and legal terminology that may be challenging for an average consumer to understand, despite the definitions section. Some explanations use additional technical terms to define other technical terms, creating a circular reference problem. The document structure is clear with numbered sections, but some provisions about benefits and scheme operations could be presented more simply with examples or visual aids to enhance understanding.
gap_recommendations:
1. Simplify language throughout the document, avoiding legal and technical jargon where possible.
2. Add practical examples to illustrate how the scheme works in real-life scenarios.
3. Include visual aids such as flowcharts or diagrams to explain the scheme structure and benefits.
4. Provide a plain-language summary at the beginning of each section.
5. Ensure definitions use simple language rather than additional technical terms.
6. Add a FAQ section addressing common questions in straightforward language.
7. Consider user testing the document with average consumers to identify areas of confusion.
regulation_title: Information to be drafted and presented for understanding by an average consumer
regulation_text: 64. A regulated entity shall, at all times, ensure that all information it provides to consumers is drafted and presented in a way that an average consumer who considers the information can be expected to have a reasonable level of understanding to appreciate the decisions that they make and to which the information relates.
source_name: CENTRAL BANK (SUPERVISION AND ENFORCEMENT) ACT 2013 (SECTION 48) (CONSUMER PROTECTION) REGULATIONS 2025
